009package imagingbook.violajones.lib;
010
011import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
012
013
014/**
015 * Represents a Haar feature, usually composed of multiple rectangular
016 * patches (of type {@link FeaturePatch}). Instances of this class make
017 * the nodes of a {@link FeatureTree}.
018 * 
019 * @author WB
020 *
021 */
022public class FeatureNode {
023        
024        protected static final double NO_VALUE = Double.NaN;
025        protected static final int NO_CHILD = -1;
026        protected static final int LEFT = 0;
027        protected static final int RIGHT = 1;
028
029        private final int width, height;
030        private final double threshold;
031        private final double[] values;  // terminal values
032        private final int[] children;   // indexes of child nodes
033        private final FeaturePatch[] patches;
034
035
036        public FeatureNode(int width, int height, double threshold, double valL, int childL, double valR, int childR,
037                        FeaturePatch[] patches) {
038                this.width = width;
039                this.height = height;
040                this.threshold = threshold;
041                this.values = new double[] {valL, valR};
042                this.children = new int[] {childL, childR};
043                this.patches = patches;
044        }
045        
046        public double getValue(int dir) {
047                return values[dir];
048        }
049        
050        public boolean hasValue(int dir) {
051                return !Double.isNaN(values[dir]);
052        }
053        
054        public int getChild(int dir) {
055                return children[dir];
056        }
057        
058        public boolean hasChild(int dir) {
059                return children[dir] != NO_CHILD;
060        }
061        
062        public FeaturePatch[] getPatches() {
063                return patches;
064        }
065
066        /**
067         * Evaluates this feature node by applying its rectangular patches.
068         * Returns the branching direction (LEFT or RIGHT), depending on how the normalized patch 
069         * sum compares to the threshold.
070         * @param II input image (as an integral image) 
071         * @param u left position of the candidate subimage
072         * @param v top position of the candidate subimage
073         * @param scale the current scale to be applied
074         * @return The branching direction (LEFT or RIGHT).
075         */
076        public int eval(IntegralImage II, int u, int v, double scale) {
077                // calculate the area of the subimage:  TODO: w,h never change, make more efficient
078                final int w = (int) Math.round(scale * width);
079                final int h = (int) Math.round(scale * height);
080                
081                // calculate variance (std. deviation) for the complete subimage: TODO: do only once for the subimage?
082                double variance = II.getVariance(u, v, u + w - 1, v + h - 1);
083                double stdDev = (variance > 1) ? Math.sqrt(variance) : 1.0;
084
085                // calculate weighted sum over all patches (rectangles) of this feature
086                double patchSum = 0.0;
087                for (FeaturePatch patch : patches) {
088                        // scale the patch's relative position and size
089                        final int ua = u + (int) Math.round(scale *  patch.x);
090                        final int va = v + (int) Math.round(scale *  patch.y);
091                        final int ub = u + (int) Math.round(scale * (patch.x + patch.width) - 1);
092                        final int vb = v + (int) Math.round(scale * (patch.y + patch.height) - 1);
093                        
094                        // add the patch's block sum and apply the assigned weight (pos/neg)
095                        patchSum = patchSum + II.getBlockSum1(ua, va, ub, vb) * patch.weight;
096                }
097                // normalize the sum of all patches by the effective window area:
098                double patchSumNorm = patchSum / (w * h);
099                        
100                // return direction depending on how the normalized patch sum compares to the threshold
101                return (patchSumNorm < threshold * stdDev) ? LEFT : RIGHT;
102        }
103
104
105        public void print(int featureCnt) {
106                System.out.format("     feature %d: w=%d h=%d valL=%.4f valR=%.4f childL=%d childR=%d th=%.4f patches=%d\n", 
107                                featureCnt, width, height, getValue(LEFT), getValue(RIGHT), getChild(LEFT), getChild(RIGHT), 
108                                threshold, patches.length);
109                int patchCnt = 0;
110                for (FeaturePatch patch : patches) {
111                        System.out.println("           patch " + patchCnt + " " + patch.toString());
112                        patchCnt++;
113                }
114        }
115}
